Reviews.Content: Top Marks We stayed in a regular suite. It was a great deal the room was huge and had a funky '70s vibe. The bathroom had a new Jacuzzi which was wonderful. The service was excellent(with one exception-a front desk worker who would not look up our reservation.
Reviews.Author: stickerj

Reviews.Content: Great location, awesome bathroom, some amazing noise Hotel Gillow is in an awesome, central location and overall I'm really glad I stayed here. We had 2 top-floor rooms with private balconies and they were very nice; they were very clean, the shower in the bathroom was 5 star, the people at the front desk were very friendly and very helpful. We slept great the first night, however on Friday night there was a rooftop club 1/2 block away that pounded the music out until 2:00AM and it was literally the worst noise I've ever had in a hotel room. Our windows shook with each beat of the drum and I could literally feel the music thumping in my chest. I wouldn't advise staying here on a Friday or Saturday night but mid-week it was fabulous.
Reviews.Author: Over60Countries

Reviews.Content: Great location but falls short on amenities Having previously stayed at the Hotel Catedral, owned by the same hotel group, I was attracted to the Hotel Gillow by two factors. One, its superb, central location. Two, the attractive and appealing Art Deco facade and the warm, cozy lobby.When we arrived at 2:30 p.m., our reserved King room was not available. The genial desk person offered us a room with a double bed and a balcony. We really wanted the King bed room. She then offered us a Junior Suite with a King bed, at the price of a two-bed room, for our first night, after which we'd have to move. My wife didn't like the idea of moving, and the suite was somewhat more expensive than the King room. About that time, the desk person informed us that a King room would be ready in a few minutes, so we decided to wait. After perhaps 45 minutes, we happliy got the key to the room. However, when we went up, the housekeeper was just starting to clean the room. We waited another 15 to 20 minutes, and at last, took possession of the space. This delay put somewhat of a kink in our plans for the afternoon.The room itself was spacious and adequate, although a bit worn,. We'd grown accustomed to the well maintained rooms of the Hotel Catedral in Centro, and the Hotel Milan in Colonia Roma. However, everything functioned o.k.The window overlooked Calle Isabel La Cat贸lica, and thus some street noise came in. The first night, we used earplugs, but managed without them the second night.We loved the convenient location. We walked all about, enjoying the center city. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, as we had more ambitious dining plans.I tried to use the Internet PCs twice, but was frustrated by preinstalled software, worn keyboard and the very expensive rate of $15 pesos per 30 minutes. I hadn't brought my laptop, as I'd inquired beforehand about the presence of a wi-fi network, and was told it was available only in the lobby and restaurant.Overall, if we stay in the Centro of Mexico City again, I'd choose the Hotel Catedral. It's only about 4 blocks farther out, but the rooms and amenities are much nicer, at a similar price.
Reviews.Author: Don_Cuevas

Reviews.Content: Spanish run hotel in Mexico City!!! Mexico was my final destination in my around the world trip. I was really glad i stayed at this hotel due to its great location, great service and great value. The rooms are clean and spacious and my room had a lovely view. Once i got to the hotel i was at walking distance from a lot of Mexico City sites. This Spanish run hotel was, in my experience, one of the best price/quality hotel in my whole trip. The restaurant is tasty and very reasonable price.Try the paella.

Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel to stay in I highly recommend this hotel, for it麓s excellent location close to the main square in Mexico City, and also for good prices and service.The hotel restaurant is also great offering varios dishes at good prices compared with other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Content: Great price great location We stated at Hotel Gillow the week of a family wedding in Mexico City. We got a suite for 4 of us for the week and it was pretty big (two rooms with bathroom between and a sitting area). This hotel had large, clean rooms at a very reasonable price. Some with patios and great views. The noise was not a bother for us. Walking distance to many great locations with shopping, food spots, site seeing, etc. For the price, we were very pleased! Be careful when using the toilet, they are very sensitive!!Overall, a nice stay at a great price!

Reviews.Content: Useful downtown option I usually stay at the Gillow when I come in late off a flight and don鈥檛 have a booking. They always seem to have rooms available. I don鈥檛 stay here on longer visits, since the centro historico is dead at night. Rooms are large and a bit dreary, but comfortable enough if you don鈥檛 mind quite a hard bed. Staff are friendly and helpful and I think most speak a bit of English. The restaurant does a perfectly adequate buffet breakfast and there is a ten percent discount on the room rate for cash.I arrived at 1.30am on my last visit, rang the main door bell and was in my room and asleep within five minutes!

Reviews.Content: A Gem We stayed here for 12 days; part of the time, there were 4 of us and the rest just two.We had a great room with a separate bedroom and plenty of space. The staff were fantastic, the management helpful.Their restaurant recommendations were right on the money, their assistance on the smallest details was always there.The price was so remarkable that I don't want to share it....the location was perfect for exploring. Taxis were always available (even if a bit more expensive).I would return here time and again; there is not enough that I could say about it.Sarah R. Belletto
Reviews.Author: srbelle

Reviews.Content: Good Price/Quality for a short stay in Mexico City When I was still in France I tried to book this hotel by phone.The women told me that there were no availability. They gave me the phone number of Hotel Canada where I booked.Arrived in Mexico, Hotel Canada told us that unfortunatly there were no room available !!!We were furious !They wend us to Hotel Gillow....Well, Hotel Gillow is a nice Price/quality hotel.It's very well locatedThe room is cleanThe walls are a little bit thin but in general everything is fine;Don't hesitate to ask info for restaurants or things to visit at the reception.It's perfect for a short stay in Mexico City
Reviews.Author: maureenpicard

Reviews.Content: Hotel Gillow....It's a hotel. The Gillow was well located, on the corner of Isabel la Catolica and Cinco de Mayo about two block from the Z贸calo. The area felt safe with a heavy police presence especially during the day and we walked back from a taco place off Madero around 11:30pm/midnight with no problems. We were on the third floor unmber 302 on Isabela Catolica. The rooms are basic yet ours was big. We had a little balcony, a closet,a table and 5 chairs, bathroom with hot water at all times of day. Feels like the place was remodeled or refurnish in the 70's. There was fresh water on each floor, although I ended up going to the sixth floor to get water as the bottle on the 3rd was very slow, almost a trickle. We had no safe in our room, but locked the bags that we had left in the room and left left nothing out and had no problem. There are safes available in the lobby. There is a decent restaurant behind the lobby. We paid about $50 a night for a king size. There is alot of a lot of noise/traffic on Cinco de Mayo and Isabel la Catolica till late and starting again very early, but there also very good views. Overall I would stay there again as it is a good value for the location and was clean, but would request an interior room.

Reviews.Content: Great location, tired property The people at Hotel Gillow are really nice, and the rates are really cheap. But the hotel is very basic. It is clean. Many of the rooms are large, and some have terraces. The bathrooms are modern. The decor is drab to nonexistent, though; the beds are hard; the carpets are stained. It is fine. A good way to economize and have money left over to spend on artesania and restaurants. (They, by the way, have a decent little restaurant of their own). But it is not in any way special.
Reviews.Author: newyorkjourno

Reviews.Content: Hotel Gillow Hotel Gillow was a wonderful place to stay. The staff was friendly and the room was very clean. I couldn't ask for a better place to stay. If you pay in cash they give you a 10% disc.. Ask for a six floor balcony room. I would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: browndog77

Reviews.Content: Will be Back ASAP I just spent a week at the Hotel Gillow and found it a nice place to stay. My husband and I like to stay at 4* plus places so I was reluctant about the hotel (booked during a tour). What it lacked in fancy it far more made up in other ways. They have a secure lock box system behind the desk. Very, very helpful and kind staff, and the rooms were very clean and neat. The location could not be beat. Two blocks from the Zocalo, Palace, Cathedral, etc and easy walks to the musems... I walked at night till 11:00 pm alone and the area is safe and clean.Hint: Ask for a 6th floor room, some come with great balconies and views that can't be beat!Staff arranged for a companion/taxi to take me to the markets and he stayed with me while shopping and helped with negotiations. Beware, the nice looking taxis on the side of the roads, they have a tendencing to come with a nice, polite mugging. Hotel staff will make sure that you are with a safe, honest and reliable driver.
Reviews.Author: NightOwls

Reviews.Content: Old fashioned service in Mexico City Hotel Gillow is a solid, old-fashioned hotel in the heart of Mexico City. I stayed there for a week on a business trip. Large room and comfortable bed. No in-room safe, but there is an old-fashioned safety box system behind the hotel desk that actually seems more secure than the standard in-room safes (but boxes are only accessible 8 a.m. to 11 p.m.). Very conveniently located for the Metro and the city centre (tourist and business districts). Felt very safe in the neighbourhood. Plenty of staff on duty at all times (even when I checked out at 3 a.m. to catch an early plane). Good security. I ate breakfast and dinner a few times in the restaurant - fairly standard food for Mexico, and good service. In the neighbourhood there are plenty of restaurants and bars, with a wide variety of price ranges. I took taxis from the hotel, and they were safe and very fairly priced (only 100 pesos to the airport). It helps if you speak a little Spanish (mine is very rudimentary), but when I had to do a complicated transaction there was someone at the desk with enough English to help me.Ask for a room on the top floor, as you get a patio with views over the city.By the way - Mexico City is a wonderful, friendly place. The people I met were charming and helpful, in spite of my terrible Spanish. I am sure there is crime, as in other big cities, but I felt safe in the tourist and business areas, and on the Metro. I have to say that the museums (Anthropology; Templo Mayor) are absolutely stunning.
Reviews.Author: old-jogger

Reviews.Content: Best value hotel in Mexico City Quite simply you won't find a better combination of price, location and facilities in Mexico City. Located about three stumbles from the Zocalo, in the historic heart of Mexico City, you really feel like you're sampling part of the history of the capital when you stay there, much more pleasant than some of the other identikit charmless hotels in the same price bracket. And a whole site cleaner and better located to boot.Hotel Gillow is one of the hidden gems of Mexico City, so much so that one of my Mexican friends who was desperate to pass on some 'local' knowledge, took me there to proudly announce that he was showing the the best kept secret around! He was quite crestfallen when he found out that I'd stayed there already.Incidentally, if you are staying for a decent while, the street on which the hotel is located (Isabela la Catolica) is famous for its tailors. You can pick up a made to measure suit from around 100 USD (although the better cloths and tailors will probably set you back upwards of 200 USD), just pick the cloth you like from the many retailers in this street, ask them for recommendations for a tailor and away you go. Why not make the arrangments when you arrive, spend a few weeks travelling Mexico, and pick it up when you return home?
Reviews.Author: Bo_Duke
